qas.question: What is the total area of Montana?
What state does Montana border to the south?
What state does it border to the west?

context: With a total area of <a0_0>147,040 square miles<a0_0/> (380,800 km2), Montana is slightly larger than Japan. It is the fourth largest state in the United States after Alaska, Texas, and California; the largest landlocked U.S. state; and the 56th largest national state/province subdivision in the world. To the north, Montana shares a 545-mile (877 km) border with three Canadian provinces: British Columbia, Alberta, and Saskatchewan, the only state to do so. It borders North Dakota and South Dakota to the east, <a1_0>Wyoming<a1_0/> to the south and <a2_0>Idaho<a2_0/> to the west and southwest.
